questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is a variant of the Best-First Search?
What is the main idea behind the Best-First Search algorithm?

answers.a: To systematically explore all possible paths in a graph
answers.b: To always choose the shortest path to the goal node
answers.c: To use heuristics to guide the search towards the goal node
answers.d: To randomly choose a path to follow until the goal node is reached

questions.question: Which of the following is a heuristic used in Best First Search?

answers.a: Depth of the node in the search tree
answers.b: The cost of the path from the start node to the current node
answers.c: The estimated cost of the cheapest path from the current node to the goal node

questions.question: What is the main advantage of Best First Search over Breadth First Search?

answers.a: It is guaranteed to find the optimal solution
answers.b: It requires less memory than Breadth First Search
answers.c: It can be used to search for solutions in infinite spaces
answers.d: It is faster than Breadth First Search

questions.question: Which of the following is not a part of the Best First Search Algorithm?
What is the primary goal of the Best First Search Algorithm?

answers.a: To find the shortest path from the start node to the end node
answers.b: To explore all possible paths in a graph
answers.c: To find the most efficient path to the goal node
answers.d: To avoid revisiting previously explored nodes
